resource.chars:
Plate III

Ideal Representation of a Disk of Complex Type;
the details of the different parts made-up from actual specimens:- <u>a</u>, cen-
tral cell; <u>b</u>, circumambient cell; <u>c,c</u>, concentric zones of oblong
<s>cells</s> superficial cells, some of them laid-open; <u>d,d</u>, marginal pores, forming several rows; <u>e,e</u>, vertical
section in a radial direction, showing the <s>simple columnar
cells of the</s> zones nearest the centre<s>, but</s> to be <s>composed</s> made up of simple
columnar cells, but those of the remainder of the disk to be
composed of two superficial layers and of an intermediate stra-
tem; <u>f,f</u>, floors of the superficial cells, with an aperture at each
end of every one; <u>g,g</u>, annular canals, running beneath these
floors <s>ind in</s> to which the passages from their apertures lead;
<u>g',g'</u> the same canals <s>in</s> near the other surface of the disk;
<u>g"</u>, the same canals, as <s>seen</s> cut transversely by a vertical section;
<u>h</u>, passage of the horizontal section through the intermediate stratum,
<s><u>h</u>, apertures leading from them into the columnar cells of the
intermediate stratum;</s> showing the summits of its columnar cells, about to enter
the annular canals; <u>i,i,i</u>, and  <u>k,k,k</u>, passage of the hori-
zontal section through two different planes of the inter-
mediate stratum, showing the connection between the column-
nar cells of different <s>segment</s> zones, by oblique passages running in
different directions
